Australia's Scott Boland took two wickets in as many balls, putting India under pressure on Day 1 of the 5th Test match in Sydney. Following the tea break, Rishabh Pant fell to a short ball, caught by Pat Cummins, and then Nitish Kumar Reddy was caught behind on the very next delivery as the Indian batting line-up struggled.

  • India went from a solid position to 120/6 amid aggressive Australian bowling.

The SCG Test witnessed heightened tension when a controversial umpiring decision kept Virat Kohli in the game after he survived a golden duck on his first ball.

  • Kohli's near dismissal: Kohli faced a delivery from Scott Boland that seemed to edge through to slips.
  • Umpire's decision: TV umpire Joel Wilson ruled Kohli not out after reviewing footage.
  • Rohit's tension: Rohit Sharma, sitting out this match, displayed visible nerves as he watched Kohli's fate unfold.
  • Impact on the match: The incident added to the competitiveness of the Test match.
“Once the decision came through in Kohli’s favour, Rohit finally sat back, appearing more at ease.”

title: Chosen for Khel Ratna honour, Gukesh promises best moves in future as well - The Hindu
summary:
Gukesh Vows to Deliver Best Moves After Winning Khel Ratna Award

Date: January 03, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Chess world champion D Gukesh has been awarded the prestigious 'Khel Ratna' honour and has promised to deliver his best moves both on and off the chessboard.

  • Gukesh is the youngest-ever world champion, having recently defeated Ding Liren.
  • This award recognizes his achievements alongside other athletes like Manu Bhaker, Harmanpreet Singh, and Praveen Kumar.
  • In a heartfelt message on social media, Gukesh thanked Prime Minister Modi for his support and promised to continue excelling in his sport.
“Honourable Prime Minister Shri @narendramodi ji, I am truly grateful and feel humbled to receive the prestigious Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award. Your words and guidance have always inspired me to strive for excellence and make the nation proud.” — Gukesh D

Gukesh aims to inspire others with his dedication to chess and his commitment to making India proud in international sports.
newTitle: Gukesh Vows to Deliver Best Moves After Winning Khel Ratna Award

Rohit Sharma's decision to opt out of the fifth Test against Australia has sparked discussion among cricket fans. His choice to prioritize team performance over individual presence, especially given his recent struggles with form, highlights his leadership qualities.

  • Rohit Sharma was struggling with form, prompting Shubman Gill's return to the playing XI.
  • India currently trails 1-2 in the Test series after four matches.
  • Irfan Pathan praised Rohit for making a selfless decision that is rare among captains.
  • The Indian team maintains secrecy regarding internal decisions, adding to the intrigue of Rohit's choice.
“It is better to leave if your batter is not able to do the talking. Rohit Sharma thought about the team and added a better player, Shubman Gill, to the Playing XI.” - Irfan Pathan

This decision bolsters Rohit Sharma's reputation as a secure and considerate leader, paving the way for team success over individual accolades.

title: Offspin to pace, and a mountain of runs: Webster's rise to Test cricket - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Offspin to pace, and a mountain of runs: Webster's rise to Test cricket

Publication Date: January 2024 | Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Australia handed a debut to Tasmania allrounder Beau Webster for the final Test against India at the SCG, highlighting a decade-long journey to the national side.

  • Webster was born in Snug, Tasmania, and made his first-class debut in February 2014.
  • He showcased his potential with back-to-back centuries in the Sheffield Shield.
  • A significant change came during the Covid lockdown when he revived his pace bowling.
  • Webster concluded the 2023-24 Sheffield Shield season with remarkable stats: 938 runs at an average of 58.62 and 30 wickets.
  • He secured his spot in the national radar with impressive performances for Australia A and in county cricket with Gloucestershire.
"I don't think I'd be standing here if I was still wheeling out the offspinners." - Beau Webster

Webster's persistence and adaptability have finally led him to a place in Test cricket, marking an important milestone in his cricketing career.
newTitle: Beau Webster's Journey to Test Cricket: From Allrounder to Debutant

summary:

Four players from the Gujarat Titans cricket team are being investigated in connection with a Rs 450-crore Ponzi scheme. The scheme, run by Bhupendrasinh Zala, has raised questions about players' involvement and potential financial losses.

  • Four Gujarat Titans cricketers are linked to BZ Group's Ponzi scheme.
  • The scheme has reportedly defrauded over 11,000 investors.
  • Zala promised annual returns of 36% but has now defaulted.
  • The investigation is ongoing, with the CID working to recover funds.
"Zala reportedly confessed during interrogation that he had failed to return the investments made by the cricketers involved."

title: Raza, Nyamhuri share spoils as Afghanistan all out for 157 - Hindustan Times
summary:
Raza, Nyamhuri share spoils as Afghanistan all out for 157

Date: Jan 02, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Veteran Sikandar Raza and teenager Newman Nyamhuri took three wickets each as Zimbabwe bowled out Afghanistan for 157 on Thursday on the first day of the second Test in Bulawayo.

  • Zimbabwe started their innings with 6 runs at stumps.
  • Captain Craig Ervine won the toss and chose to bowl, capitalizing on favorable conditions.
  • Afghanistan's captain Hashmatullah Shahidi and Rahmat Shah had notable performances in the past, but couldn't replicate their success this time.
  • A 27-run last-wicket stand helped Afghanistan reach a total of 157.
“Given the conditions, I was convinced bowling first was the way to go. The wicket had been under covers for some time.” - Craig Ervine

This match showcases the promising talent of Zimbabwe's young players and highlights the challenges faced by the Afghan team in this Test series.
newTitle: Raza and Nyamhuri Lead Zimbabwe as Afghanistan Bowled Out for 157

title: "Rohit Sharma Addressed The Media...": Sunil Gavaskar Gives Fresh Twist To 'Rift' Rumours - NDTV Sports
summary:
Sunil Gavaskar Dismisses Rumors of Rifts in Indian Cricket Team

Publication Date: January 1, 2025

Source: NDTV

Following India's significant loss to Australia, speculations about conflicts within the team's dressing room have surfaced. Sunil Gavaskar, however, attributes these stories to media exaggeration and insists they only arise after team losses.

  • Reports of dressing room rifts emerged after India's defeat to Australia.
  • Sunil Gavaskar criticized the media for fueling these rumors.
  • Gavaskar stated that such speculation occurs frequently after Indian team losses.
  • Rohit Sharma may be rested for the upcoming fifth Test against Australia.
  • Gautam Gambhir clarified that these reports are not truthful.
"Every time the Indian team has not done well, these things about rifts come up. It's almost as if we people feel that the Indian team cannot lose." - Sunil Gavaskar

In conclusion, while media speculations create narratives of conflict, both Gavaskar and Gambhir emphasize the need to focus on team performance instead.
newTitle: Sunil Gavaskar Dismisses Rumors of Rifts in Indian Cricket Team

title: Manu Bhaker, D Gukesh Among Four Champion Athletes Selected For Khel Ratna Award - News18
summary:
Manu Bhaker, D Gukesh Among Four Champion Athletes Selected For Khel Ratna Award

Published on: January 02, 2025, 21:01 IST | Source: News18

The Ministry of Youth Affairs & Sports has announced the National Sports Awards 2024, honoring Manu Bhaker, D Gukesh, Harmanpreet Singh, and Praveen Kumar with the Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award.

  • Ministry announced the awards on January 02, 2025.
  • Manu Bhaker is the first athlete from independent India to win two medals in a single Olympics.
  • D Gukesh became the youngest World champion and helped the Indian team win gold at the Chess Olympiad.
  • Harmanpreet Singh led the Indian hockey team to a bronze medal and Praveen Kumar was crowned T64 champion in para athletics.
  • The awards ceremony will be held on January 17, 2025, at Rashtrapati Bhavan.
"The awardees will receive their awards from the President of India."

The recognition of these athletes highlights their contributions and achievements in Indian sports, inspiring future generations.
newTitle: Manu Bhaker, D Gukesh Among Four Champion Athletes Selected For Khel Ratna Award

title: Gautam Gambhir turns down request to 'allow Rohit Sharma to play in Sydney and retire' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Gautam Gambhir Rejects Rohit Sharma's Playing Request Ahead of Sydney Test

Date: Jan 02, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

In a recent turn of events, Gautam Gambhir has opted not to include Rohit Sharma in the playing XI for the final Test against Australia, prioritizing team performance over individual requests.

  • Rohit Sharma, amidst poor performance, decided to 'opt out' of the playing XI.
  • His performance in the series has been subpar, averaging just 6.20.
  • Shubman Gill is set to replace Rohit in Sydney, while KL Rahul will open the innings.
  • Gambhir's decision is influenced by the need for a win to bolster India's chances in the World Test Championship.
  • An influential cricket administrator requested Gambhir allow Rohit to play and retire on-field, which he declined.
“Everything is fine with Rohit. The head coach is there. That should be fine.” – Gautam Gambhir

The decision emphasizes Gambhir's commitment to team success as India eyes the Border-Gavaskar Trophy and a spot in the World Test Championship final.
newTitle: Gautam Gambhir Rejects Rohit Sharma's Playing Request Ahead of Sydney Test
